node.title: These chimney stacks were demolished at Lithgow more than 20 years ago. Today more will follow, marking the end of an era
node.alt: demolishing chimneys at Wallerawang power station
node.description: NSW coal station workers pay homage to the history of one of the state's first fossil fuel power generators, set to be demolished with today to make way for a renewable energy hub.
node.content:
["One of the oldest coal-fired power plants in New South Wales will be partly demolished today as Lithgow's skyline is set to change forever.", "One of the central west city's most iconic symbols, the chimney towers of the old Wallerawang station, will disappear in an explosion today.\u00a0", "The two 175-metre tall smokestacks and a boiler house could be seen from miles away and stood as a symbol of Lithgow's enriched history of coal mining.\u00a0", "Wallerawang was first erected in the 1957, at the height of Lithgow's mining boom when thousands of locals were employed in the industry.\u00a0", "The town itself was built for and around the station.\u00a0", "It was shut down in 2014 after more than five decades of operation and has remained idle since.\u00a0", "", "
The site of the old Wallerawang Power Station was shut down in 2014 but will have a new life as a renewable energy hub.\u00a0(Supplied: EnergyAustralia)
", "The station supplied up to 15 per cent of the state's power, being one of the largest and oldest in New South Wales.\u00a0", "Today, just over 800 people have jobs in surrounding mines and at the nearby Mount Piper Power Station.\u00a0", "
Becoming a distant memory
", "", "
Colin Robertson has worked at coal-fired power stations his entire life, and\u00a0some of his fondest memories are at Wallerawang.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "One of the oldest living operators at Wallerawang 91-year-old Colin Robertson said his time working as a station operator were some of the best years of his life.\u00a0", "He started working there shortly after it opened in 1958 and much of his job involved shift work fixing the boilers and turbines.\u00a0", "While the towers will be missed by many locals who enjoy the sights, even those who know it best believe it is time for them to go.\u00a0", "\"What else are they going to do with it ... it's got to be used,\" he said.\u00a0", "
In the hearts of generations
", "David Rawsthorne worked at Wallewarang from 1990 but has since moved over to Mount Piper.", "\"It is outdated technology but it is also part of the local history,\" Mr Rawsthorne said.\u00a0", "He followed in his father's footsteps.", "\"Unlike many people who work in offices, they don't necessarily have multi-generational workforces whereas in the power industry it happens quite a lot,\" he said.\u00a0\u00a0", "As a photographer, he said, it is a sight that cannot be unseen and many locals will be at a loss.\u00a0", "\"It's old steel, modern electronics all mingled into one\".", "", "
The old control room at the power station in action from the 1950s.\u00a0(Supplied: Ray Pippy Hamment)
", "A company which saves stranded fossil fuel assets,\u00a0Greenspot, bought the Wallerawang plant from Energy Australia last year.", "It will turn it into a renewables hub, which requires the removal of most of the site's infrastructure.", "More than 40,000 tonnes of scrap metal and 25,000 tonnes of concrete will be recycled from the demolition.\u00a0", "The old turbine hall, cooling tower and shortest chimney will be retained.\u00a0", "The first project it will work on is\u00a0a big 500 megawatt storage battery which will connect to nearby transmission infrastructure.\u00a0", "", "
The Wallerawang Power Station will become a renewable energy hub and site for a big storage battery.\u00a0(ABC News: Jonathan Hair)
", "Greenspot also plans to turn the 620-hectare site into a business park.\u00a0", "
Replacing the jobs of the past
", "The Mayor of the Lithgow City Council Ray Thompson said when the station closed, along with the Angus Place Mine, about 600 hundreds of workers lost their jobs.\u00a0", "\"None of those jobs have been replaced yet so we see as a council that the repurposing of the Wallewarang Power Station as one of the things that will create a lot of jobs in our town,\" Cr Thompson said.\u00a0", "Lithgow is in the face of a transition away from jobs in the fossil fuel industry, confirmed when Energy Australia brought forward the closure of the region's other power station to 2040.\u00a0", "\"We believe that could be brought forward even further. We've got to be ready for it,\" he said.\u00a0", "Cr Thompson said with companies like Greenspot revitalising old infrastructure, there is optimism the city can face the reality of a renewable future.\u00a0"]
